compute_zonal_stats_per_categoryÔÉÅ

eolab.rastertools.processing.stats.compute_zonal_stats_per_category(geoms: GeoDataFrame, image: str, bands: List[int] = [1], stats: List[str] = ['min', 'max', 'mean', 'std'], categories: GeoDataFrame | None = None, category_index: str = 'Classe', category_labels: Dict[str, str] | None = None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Compute zonal statistics for an input raster image, categorized by specified subregions.

This function calculates statistical metrics for a raster image over a set of geometries (e.g., polygons) provided in geoms. If a set of categories (subregions within each geometry) is provided, statistics are computed separately for each category within each geometry.

Parameters:

  • geoms (GeoDataFrame) ‚Äì A GeoDataFrame containing the input geometries (e.g., polygons) to compute statistics over.

  • image (str) ‚Äì The file path to the input raster image.

  • bands (List[int], optional) ‚Äì A list of raster band indices to process. Defaults to [1] (the first band).

  • stats (List[str], optional) ‚Äì A list of statistical metrics to compute. Supported values include: - ‚Äúmin‚Äù: Minimum value within the geometry. - ‚Äúmax‚Äù: Maximum value within the geometry. - ‚Äúmean‚Äù: Mean value within the geometry. - ‚Äústd‚Äù: Standard deviation within the geometry. Defaults to [‚Äúmin‚Äù, ‚Äúmax‚Äù, ‚Äúmean‚Äù, ‚Äústd‚Äù].

  • categories (GeoDataFrame, optional) ‚Äì A GeoDataFrame containing category geometries that define subregions of the input geometries. Defaults to None.

  • category_index (str, optional) ‚Äì The column in the categories GeoDataFrame that identifies category labels for each geometry. Defaults to ‚ÄòClasse‚Äô.

  • category_labels (Dict[str, str], optional) ‚Äì A dictionary mapping category values (from category_index) to human-readable labels. If provided, these labels replace category values in the output. Defaults to None.

Returns:

A nested list of dictionaries containing the computed statistics: - Outer list corresponds to each input geometry in geoms. - Inner list corresponds to each raster band being processed. - Each dictionary maps statistic names (e.g., ‚Äúmean‚Äù, ‚Äúmax‚Äù) to their respective values.

Return type:

List[List[Dict[str, float]]]

Raises:

IOError ‚Äì If any input geometry is not of type Polygon or MultiPolygon.

Notes

  • For each geometry in geoms, the function subdivides it into subregions based on the geometries in categories (if provided). Statistics are then computed for each subregion separately.

  • The function assumes that the raster image is georeferenced and aligned with the coordinate system of the input geometries.

Example

``` import geopandas as gpd from rastertools import compute_zonal_stats_per_category

geoms = gpd.read_file(‚Äúregions.shp‚Äù) categories = gpd.read_file(‚Äúlandcover.shp‚Äù) image_path = ‚Äúsatellite_image.tif‚Äù

stats = compute_zonal_stats_per_category(

geoms=geoms, image=image_path, categories=categories, category_index=‚ÄùLand_Type‚Äù, category_labels={1: ‚ÄúForest‚Äù, 2: ‚ÄúUrban‚Äù, 3: ‚ÄúWater‚Äù}

)

for geometry_stats in stats:

print(geometry_stats)

```
